description: President Joe Biden’s son Hunter will tentatively have to face trial in June over charges that he violated federal gun laws.
title: Hunter Biden Gun Charges Trial Tentatively Set in June

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House correspondent Jordan Fabian looks at the long 2024 presidential campaign ahead. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: The Long Biden-Trump Race for the White House Is Just Beginning

description: Canada is rebooting an official forum to smooth its C$3.4-billion-a-day ($2.5 billion) trading relationship with the US ahead of the “unpredictability” Prime Minister Justin Trudeau sees with a potential return of Donald Trump.
title: Canada Revives US Trade Forum Ahead of Biden-Trump Poll Rematch

description: Donald Trump has talked about hedge fund titan John Paulson as Treasury secretary if he wins the November presidential election, and has held a series of meetings with potential cabinet picks, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Trump Has Raised Billionaire John Paulson as Potential Treasury Pick

description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken called on Israel to dramatically increase the amount of food aid getting into Gaza, saying supplies allowed in since the outbreak of the Israel-Hamas war remain insufficient.
title: Blinken Wants to See Israel ‘Flooding the Zone’ With Food Aid

description: TikTok’s future in the US is suddenly unclear.
title: These Are the Biggest Questions Now Facing TikTok

description: Catalonia’s regional government called a snap election almost a year ahead of time, setting the stage for an unexpected test for Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez.
title: Spain’s Sanchez Faces Unexpected Test in Snap Catalan Election

description: Dutch election winner Geert Wilders has abandoned his bid to become prime minister in a compromise to push forward talks to form a right-wing cabinet.
title: Wilders Willing to Forgo Dutch Premiership to Advance Coalition Talks

description: Justin Trudeau’s government will end up tapping the bond market for around C$250 billion ($186 billion) in debt next year, one of the country’s biggest lenders says.
title: CIBC Sees Canada Government Bond Issuance Rising 22%

description: President Vladimir Putin halted the seizure of the local Russian subsidiary of French yogurt maker Danone SA.
title: Putin Halts Seizure of Russian Business of France’s Danone

description: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis is deploying 250 law enforcement officers and an air-and-sea fleet to Florida’s southern waters to help curb a potential wave of Haitian immigrants.
title: Florida Deploys Officers, Fleet to Halt Potential Haitian Influx

description: Harvard University economics professor Kenneth Rogoff said both President Joe Biden and his predecessor and challenger Donald Trump risk sending US debt levels into dangerous territory as Washington fails to grasp that the era of ultra-low interest rates won’t come back.
title: Rogoff Says Biden, Trump Favor ‘Blowing Up’ US Debt

description: The world’s richest nations agreed to cancel more than $2 billion of Somalia’s liabilities to help the war-torn nation restore debt sustainability.
title: Paris Club Creditors Agree to Cancel $2 Billion of Somali Debt

description: Ambassadors of the European Union agreed in principle to provide €5 billion ($5.5 billion) in military support for Ukraine, after member states reached a compromise to allow purchases from outside the bloc.
title: EU Gives Initial Backing to €5 Billion Weapons Fund for Ukraine

description: United States Steel Corp. tumbled after a report that US President Joe Biden plans to express “serious concern” over its proposed takeover by Nippon Steel Corp.
title: US Steel Falls on Report Biden Will Voice Concern on Deal

description: UK Chancellor Jeremy Hunt considered giving first-time homebuyers more help in last week’s budget but chose not to amid concerns that house prices could fall further.
title: Hunt Ditched Help for UK Homebuyers on Negative Equity Fears

description: A measure of how well and how long people live offers fresh evidence of a growing split between rich and poor countries, according to the United Nations, which warned widening global inequality risks stoking polarization and gridlock.
title: Rich Nations Are Leaving Poor Behind in Risk to Global Stability, UN Says

description: Brazil President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva wants to expand agriculture exports to India and Africa, focusing more on new markets while trade talks between a South America trade bloc and the European Union languish.
title: Brazil Eyes Farm Exports to India and Africa With EU Deal Deadlocked

description: Governments don’t have a great track record of keeping up with emerging technology. But the complex, rapidly evolving field of artificial intelligence raises legal, national security and civil rights concerns that can’t be ignored. The European Union passed a sweeping law that would put guardrails on the technology; in China, no company can produce an AI service without proper approvals. The US is still working on its regulatory approach. While Congress considers legislation, some American citie
title: Regulate AI? How US, EU and China Are Going About It

description: Republican Rep. David Valadao and Democrat Rudy Salas are the top two finishers in the primary race for California’s 22nd Congressional District, according to the Associated Press.
title: Rep. David Valadao, Rudy Salas Advance in California House Race

description: As some of the harshest Republican critics of TikTok soften their stance on the China-backed social media app, one billionaire donor’s name is ricocheting around Washington.
title: Jeff Yass’ $15 Billion TikTok Fortune Shines Light on His GOP Clout

description: Comments made by a top Conservative Party donor were “racist” and “despicable” but the individual has expressed remorse and the apology should be accepted, UK Chancellor Jeremy Hunt said.
title: Hunt Says Tory Donor’s Comments Are Racist, But Apology Should be Accepted

description: The US House of Representatives passed a bill to ban TikTok in the US unless its Chinese owner sells the video-sharing app, mounting the most serious challenge yet to a service that’s used by 170 million Americans but critics call a national-security threat.
title: US House Passes Bill That Would Force TikTok Sale or Ban It

description: The European Investment Bank is seeking climate-related investments in Africa, the bank’s Vice-President Thomas Ostros said.
title: European Investment Bank Sees Green Opportunities in Africa

description: Donald Trump scored a partial victory in battling his Georgia prosecution for attempting to overturn the 2020 presidential election when a judge dismissed several criminal counts against him and other defendants, though the bulk of the sprawling indictment remains in place.
title: Trump Judge in Georgia Case Tosses Some Counts Against Him

description: Hedge fund manager John Paulson and the chairman and CEO of Cantor Fitzgerald Howard W. Lutnick are hosting a fundraiser for Donald Trump in Palm Beach, Florida on April 6, according to people familiar with the event.
title: John Paulson, Howard Lutnick to Host Trump Palm Beach Fundraiser

description: Banxico Deputy Governor Omar Mejia said he sees room to adjust the Mexican central bank’s reference rate ahead of its next meeting on March 21.
title: Mexico Central Bank Has Room to Adjust Key Rate, Deputy Governor Mejia Says

description: Defense Secretary Grant Shapps has prevented British aid drops over the Gaza Strip due to concerns about the risk to civilians, people familiar with the matter said, underscoring the challenges facing allied efforts to get supplies into the war zone.
title: Grant Shapps Blocks UK Aid Drops in Gaza Over Risk to Civilians

description: Hungary’s Ganz-Mavag has bid for rolling stock producer Talgo, but the government in Madrid is concerned about links to the leadership in Budapest.
title: Spain Is Concerned About Orban in €600 Million Rail Deal

description: Get caught up on the day’s political news
title: Tory Racism Row: Donor's Comments Overshadow PMQs, Despite Better Economic News

description: Ukraine’s top diplomat said badly needed ammunition stocks being collected through a Czech-led initiative will begin arriving on the front line in the “foreseeable future” rather than months.
title: Ukraine Says Fresh Ammunition to Arrive in ‘Foreseeable Future’

description: The European Investment Bank is considering ways to expand its support for the defense industry, in a move that would help the EU bolster its security in response to the growing threat from Russia.
title: Russian Threat Spurs EU’s Lending Arm to Look at Funding Defense

description: Rishi Sunak defied pressure to return a £10 million ($12.8 million) donation to his Conservative Party from a businessman who the prime minister condemned for past “racist” comments about an opposition politician.
title: Sunak Refuses to Return Donation as Racism Row Embroils Tories

description: Sonae SGPS SA, Portugal’s biggest private-sector employer, wants the nation’s political parties to ensure stability and agree on key reforms following an election that’s likely to result in a minority government.
title: Portugal’s Biggest Employer Urges Parties to Agree on Reforms After Election

description: The ex-FBI informant charged with falsely claiming that Hunter Biden received millions of dollars in bribes from a Ukrainian energy company is also the spy behind a US case targeting a prominent Austrian.
title: Ex-FBI Spy Charged With Hunter Biden Lie Ensnared a Bank Chief

description: Bernard L. Schwartz, the longtime head of Loral Corp. who became one of the US Democratic Party’s top financial backers during Bill Clinton’s presidency, has died. He was 98.
title: Bernard L. Schwartz, Loral CEO Who Funded Democrats, Dies at 98

description: In the days leading up to the Super Tuesday primaries this month, viewers of Walt Disney Co.’s Hulu streaming service in Los Angeles saw a blizzard of political ads featuring everything from US Senate candidates to the battle over a city council seat.
title: Political Ads Surge on Streaming TV as Candidates Follow Viewers
Macron Faces EU Election Test With French Voters in Economic Misery

description: Australia is pressing for a second consecutive budget surplus even as weakening commodity export prices and rising unemployment crimp revenue gains, Treasurer Jim Chalmers will say in a speech in Sydney.
title: Australia Eyes Second Budget Surplus Despite Iron Ore-Price Drop

description: Denmark’s government presented a plan to increase defense spending by more than 40 billion kroner ($6 billion) through 2028 and said it will start drafting women into its military to help counter an increased threat from Russia.
title: Denmark to Add $6 Billion to Defense, Start Drafting Women

description: China’s Foreign Minister Wang Yi is set to travel to Australia next week, the highest level visit from Beijing in almost seven years and the latest sign of warming ties after years of frosty diplomacy.
title: Chinese Foreign Minister to Visit Australia as Ties Warm

description: Rishi Sunak’s government is considering curbing the number of Chinese nationals who can enter the UK on official business for the People’s Republic and bypass normal visa checks, over fears the system is being abused to bring spies into Britain.
title: UK Weighs Curbs on Chinese Official Visas Over Spy Risk

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Does a Gangster Called Barbecue Control Haiti?

description: Olaf Scholz’s top coalition partners are pushing the German chancellor to drop his opposition to supplying long-range Taurus cruise missiles to Ukraine.
title: Scholz’s Partners Push to Change His Mind on Ukraine Missiles

description: Soldiers take part in a military exercise at the Oksboel Shooting and Training Ground in Jutland, Denmark.
title: Denmark to Add $6 Billion to Defense, Start Drafting Women

description: Ukraine said Russian air strikes killed and injured civilians as three cities were targeted with missiles and drones, damaging hundreds of apartments in residential blocks.
title: Ukraine Says Russia Strikes Apartment Blocks, Killing Civilians

description: A top aide to the late Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny blamed President Vladimir Putin for a hammer attack on him in Lithuania, and vowed to continue pursuing his campaign against the Kremlin.
title: Navalny Ally Blames Putin For Violent Hammer Attack in Lithuania

description: China needs to boost domestic demand and adjust its industrial policy to counter rising criticism of overcapacity from the US and Europe, according to a prominent economist who advises the government.
title: China Adviser Flags Geopolitical Risks in Xi’s Industry Push

description: A Russian cargo plane under US sanctions touched down in Pyongyang this week for an unannounced trip that raised concerns about illegal arms transfers, a specialist news service reported.
title: Sanctioned Russian Plane in Pyongyang as Arms Trade Picks Up

description: President Vladimir Putin said Wednesday that Russia is ready to use nuclear weapons if its sovereignty or independence is threatened, issuing another blunt warning to the West just days ahead of an election in which he’s all but certain to win another six-year term.
title: Putin Says Russia Ready to Use Nuclear Weapons if Independence Threatened

description: Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk said he will travel to Berlin on Friday to discuss aid for Ukraine with French President Emmanuel Macron and German Chancellor Olaf Scholz following talks with US President Joe Biden at the White House on Tuesday.
title: Poland’s Tusk to Meet Macron and Scholz to Discuss Ukraine Aid

description: Ukrainian drone attacks halted three oil refineries deep within Russian territory in an assault President Vladimir Putin said was aimed at disrupting his presidential election later this week.
title: Ukraine Hits Third Russian Refinery In Escalating Drone Strikes

description: Chinese state media has touted President Xi Jinping as a market-friendly reformer on par with the paramount leader Deng Xiaoping, in an apparent attempt to dispel skepticism over the country’s growth outlook.
title: China Hails Xi as Market Reformer Like Deng in Sweeping Profile

description: South Korea’s government lined up more money to support a health-care system hit by a walkout from thousands of trainee doctors, which looks set to widen as medical students seek leaves of absences to show their support.
title: South Korea Provides More Funds for Health Care During Doctors’ Walkout

description: Thailand’s Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin will relinquish his role as finance minister, according to a local media report, a change that may ease tension with the central bank over monetary policy.
title: Thai PM Poised to Step Aside as Finance Chief, Report Says

description: President Vladimir Putin said Russia would demand security guarantees to consider talks to end the war in Ukraine, telling a state news agency that “realities on the ground” should be the basis of any negotiations.
title: Putin Says Ukraine Deal Requires Security Pledges for Russia

description: Donald Trump has clinched the Republican presidential nomination, capping off a stunning political comeback fueled by grievance and vengeance and formally entering what’s poised to be the longest and costliest general election in recent memory.
title: Trump Wins Republican Nomination, Setting Up Rematch with Biden

description: Africa’s biggest freight rail market is on the cusp of being transformed by private operators, the head of the operator of the continent’s largest rolling-stock fleet said.
title: Africa’s Biggest Freight Rail Market Set for Private Operators

description: US President Joe Biden pledged to look into a petition from a group of unions asking his administration to review China’s subsidies for shipbuilders, as tensions between the world’s two largest economy simmer during a major election year.
title: Biden Says US to Review Union Petition on China Shipbuilding

description: The Australian government is playing down concerns over the delivery schedule for its fleet of nuclear-powered submarines after the Biden administration reduced orders for new vessels in its latest defense budget.
title: Australia Faces Aukus Nuclear Submarine Concerns as US Order Cut

description: The US ambassador to China made a rare visit to Hong Kong as the Chinese city races to complete new security legislation that raised concerns of a chilling effect among some businesses and foreign governments.
title: US Envoy Visited Hong Kong as City Fast-Tracks New Security Law

description: President Joe Biden on Tuesday won enough delegates to secure the Democratic presidential nomination, the Associated Press reported.
title: Biden Gets Enough Delegates to Win 2024 Democratic Nomination
